title: 'My exhausting smear test battle'
description: Transgender men, such as Laurie, are not automatically contacted for potentially life-saving smear tests.

title: Films, exhibitions and more things you can now see
description: Indoor entertainment venues in many areas can now reopen, so what's on and how will they work?

title: Campaign launched to mark Queen's Platinum Jubilee
description: People across the UK are encouraged to "plant a tree for the Jubilee" to mark the Queen's 70-year reign.

title: Lockdown easing: How to socialise without breaking the bank
description: If your bank balance is looking anything but healthy right now, this might help.

title: Cricket beneath the dome
description: Is a bio-dome the saviour of summer cricket? BBC Sport imagines a new world of indoor cricket - and how players and fans might react.

title: Covid-19: YouTube launches vaccination ad campaign
description: The video-sharing site will pay for ads on buses, billboards and its own site to promote vaccination.

title: Nigeria's Boko Haram militants: Six reasons they have not been defeated
description: After more than a decade of fighting, the Islamist militant group is still causing havoc in the north-east.

title: A weather forecast from the future
description: What do conditions look like in 2050 for major sporting venues? BBC weather forecaster Simon King explains...

title: Telling the tales of the northwest Highlands
description: New documentary explores what life is like for people in remote Scotland.

title: Lebanon in free-fall: 'For me, the country now is a large jail'
description: With the local currency losing 85% of its value, Lebanon's economy is disintegrating.

title: The cost of calling out a 'rape joke'
description: One Malaysian teenager has braved a backlash for her principled stand.

title: Why we are doing this
description: The experts behind our project explain why the BBC is looking at the impact of climate change on sport.

title: The app that lets you pay to control another person's life
description: NewNew aims to connect artists with their fans who can vote on aspects of their work and daily life.

title: Quiz: How are sports battling climate change?
description: See how much you know about the environmental "good guys" of sport.

title: Eurovision winner Salvador Sobral says contest is history for him
description: Eurovision's highest-scoring winner Salvador Sobral says he now has to go his own way and set new goals.

title: A World Cup like no other?
description: Games lasting an hour and fans around the world watching in virtual reality? BBC Sport imagines what a 2050 World Cup in China might look like in the face of climate change.

title: Alisson scores winner: 'A monumental moment that could define Liverpool's season' - Danny Murphy
description: Former Liverpool midfielder Danny Murphy says Alisson's injury-time winner against West Brom means something positive has finally happened for Liverpool this season, and in an amazing way.

title: Chelsea thrashed by Barcelona in Women's Champions League final
description: Chelsea concede four goals in the first 36 minutes as Barcelona blow them away to win the Women's Champions League final.

title: Israel Gaza conflict: Homes and buildings destroyed in Sderot and Gaza City
description: Rocket attacks on Israel and air strikes on Gaza have continued, turning homes on both sides to rubble.

title: Four men arrested in anti-Semitism video investigation
description: Police arrest four men in connection with a video appearing to show anti-Semitic abuse shouted from a car.

title: Emotional Alisson pays tribute to father after keeper's dramatic winner for Liverpool
description: Alisson says he is "too emotional" as the goalkeeper scores a dramatic winner against West Brom to boost Liverpool's Champions League hopes.

title: Eurovision 2021: How this year's acts are aiming for a Covid-safe contest
description: The acts of this year's Eurovision have been navigating a global pandemic to take part in Rotterdam.

title: Covid: Increasing confidence jab works against Indian variant
description: There is "increasing confidence" Covid vaccines are effective against the variant, Matt Hancock says.

title: Child dies and four adults injured in Lancashire explosion
description: Two houses collapsed following the blast, which happened in the early hours of Sunday.

title: Israel Gaza conflict: Air strike targets Hamas leader
description: Israeli military bomb the home of Yahya Sinwar, a top militant in Gaza, on a night of air strikes.

title: Jordan Banks: Sunday league clubs hold minute's silence for boy
description: Players from dozens of Sunday league teams pay tribute to Jordan Banks, who died on Tuesday.

title: Perfectly reasonable for me to forward on PPE offer - Hancock
description: The health secretary defends his role in helping a former Tory minister try to secure a PPE deal.

title: Penarth RNLI historian wanted for lifeboat station in UK first
description: The RNLI is looking for a volunteer to chart the modern history of a lifeboat station.

title: Down's syndrome campaigner Heidi Crowter on marriage and loving life
description: Heidi Crowter is fighting for equality in the abortion law relating to Down's syndrome.

title: Property in Wales: Buying a home 'unachievable' for many
description: Nearly half the homeowners helped by the Help to Buy scheme earn at least £40,000, a report says.

title: The Papers: PM ‘must think again’ on rules, and 1m jabs ‘push’
description: Several papers look to the lifting of further rules in England amid concerns over the Indian variant.
